nodes.name: MorpherAccountMigration

nodes.documentation: @notice This function will allow migration to a target address from a _from-source address
nodes.name: allowMigrationFrom

nodes.documentation: @notice This modifier and the function below are for the backend to set a source and destination address. The user needs to be a registered user in our signup/login flow.
nodes.name: ownerConfirmMigrationAddresses

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Address is not allowed to migrate to target address"

arguments.value: Address is not allowed to migrate to target address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Address is not allowed to migrate to target address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Address is not whitelisted by backend"

arguments.value: Address is not whitelisted by backend

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Address is not whitelisted by backend"

nodes.documentation: @notice the modifier checks if an target-address allows migration
nodes.name: isAllowedToMigrateTo

nodes.documentation:
@notice To migrate the tokens we send it from the msg.sender address to _to and emit an event that TokenMigrationComplete
@dev the "if" is intentional, so that we can re-call the function as many times as we want, but it will only execute one time only
nodes.name: migrateTokens

devdoc.author: Thomas Wiesner
devdoc.details: This smart contract needs platform rights to do its job

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

devdoc.title: Account Migration Smart Contract

allowMigrationFrom(address).notice: This function will allow migration to a target address from a _from-source address

ownerConfirmMigrationAddresses(address,a.notice: This modifier and the function below are for the backend to set a source and destination address. The user needs to be a registered user in our signup/login flow.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

userdoc.notice: This Contract allows the migration of the tokens and positions from one address to another
